div.head: THE Prerogative Prie≈øts Pa≈øsing-Bell. OR Amen to the Rigid Clergy,
SECT. I.
div.p: ONe main Argument wherewith you deceive the people, is drawn (as you ≈øay) from Gods eternal Decree, who (as you argue) hath appointed every man a Calling, viz. ≈øome Carpenters, Fi≈øher-men, Tent-makers, &c. others to be≈øet apart for the Mini≈øtry. Let every man abide in the ≈øame ≈øtate wherein he was called: And for ≈øome per≈øons to multiply Callings, is equally de≈øtructive to the Republique, as for the generality of men to practice one particular Science; For if all tunn Mariners, and put to Sea, who ≈øhall ≈øtay a ≈øhoar to till the Land?

But preaching and declaring the Word of God was indifferently and equally referred and required of all; Would God all the people were Prophets, or could prophecy: This work was alike laudible in Jo≈øhua and David, as in Aaron or Eliezar.

For your Inference, That Lay or Mechanick men (≈øo called) may not preach, or Preachers may not trade or labour; the Scripture quoted, Let every man abide, &c. This Text is by you (as al≈øo many more) mi≈øpri≈øioned, it having reference to a beleeving hu≈øband, w ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ e, or ≈øervant; yoked with a wife, husband, or ma≈øter that is an Infidel, advi≈øing not to depart from each other, but continue in the ≈øame ≈øtate or condition they were linked in when they fir≈øt were called; and upon this ground, What knowe≈øt thou O man, that, &c.

To the Ab≈øurdity, If all turn Mariners, &c. I an≈øwer, That if ≈øuch (or ≈øo many) as go down in Ships are to declare the wonders of God in the deep, and all people that dwell upon Earth are to declare his goodne≈øs; certainly then no man is disfranchized of this priviledg, but rather entailed thereunto by the Light of God and Rea≈øon: And now ≈øeeing I enter li≈øt with exqui≈øite wits, who I hope will be as ingenuous to vindicate their own Judgments, as convince my apprehen≈øions, I frame an Argument in their own method.

1 Argum. What≈øoever was indefinitely commanded by Almighty God, and practi≈øed by righteous men in all ages, ought to be obeyed and pro≈øecuted of every man in his proper generation: But it was (and is) the CoÃÑmand of Almighty God, that all Creatures preach his glory, and righteous men were (and are) active to that end: Therefore every Creature (as con≈øidered mankind) hath a right to the preaching of the Go≈øpel.

An≈ø. I an≈øwer: Notwith≈øtanding all per≈øons (at a congregated meeting) have alike priviledg to preach the Go≈øpel, yet this makes not a nece≈ø≈øity that all or many ≈øpeak together: The Apo≈øtle Paul

Another fallacy wherewith you blind the people, runneth thus: That there mu≈øt be an outward Call, as well as inward, to tho≈øe that preach the Go≈øpel; and though per≈øons may be gifted, yet they are not to exerci≈øe their gifts without Ordination; and that Chri≈øt gave Commi≈ø≈øion to the Apo≈øtles, the Apo≈øtles commi≈ø≈øioned others, by vertue of which ≈øucce≈ø≈øive Power you are made Mini≈øters, and ≈øo you (of the Clergy) and you only, are to preach the Go≈øpel: How can they preach except they be ≈øent?

An≈ø.
